heading.title: Approved forms for use in connection with civil proceedings

p.text: This guide card contains the forms approved by the Uniform Rules Committee for use in civil proceedings in the Supreme, District and Local Courts and the Dust Diseases Tribunal.

There are a small number of additional forms that apply to proceedings in the Land and Environment Court from 1 July 2008. Those forms are approved under s 77A(1) of the Land and Environment Court Act 1979.
All of the approved forms can also be found at (and completed from) the Lawlink website at http://www.lawlink.nsw.gov.au/lawlink/spu/ll_ucpr.nsf/pages/ucpr_forms .
The additional Land and Environment Court forms can also be found on the Lawlink website at http://www.lawlink.nsw.gov.au/lawlink/spu/ll_ucpr.nsf/pages/ucpr_forms#lec .

If no specific approved form applies, the general Form 1 is to be used and adapted as necessary. If the matter relates to a procedure for which there was an approved form under previous rules or legislation, it may be useful to refer to the content of the old form when adapting Form 1.

Where a particular form has been approved, any documents that are filed with or issued by a court must be in the approved form: CPA s 17(3) . However, this provision is subject to the general principle that substantial (rather than strict) compliance with an approved form is sufficient: see s 80 of the Interpretation Act 1987; and generally [s 17.10]. This permission obviously sanctions merely minor variations in the format and appearance of relevant documents. For instance, where a person cannot reproduce the precise heading shade, layout or font of an approved form they can use an alternative style or layout that has the same effect (for example, a heading could be boxed or bolded and underlined rather than shaded).

heading.title: General information about the use of approved forms

p.text: The Lawlink website contains general information and guidelines about the use of the approved forms: see http://www.lawlink.nsw.gov.au/lawlink/spu/ll_ucpr.nsf/pages/ucpr_form_info#3 .
